person:biography.personal-details:content: Paolo Manghi is a computer science senior researcher (primo ricercatore) at Istituto di Scienza e Tecnologie dell’Informazione (ISTI) of Consiglio Nazionale delle Ricerche (CNR) in Pisa, Italy. He also serves as the leader of the Scholarly Communication Infrastructures Research Group (InfraScience Lab), where his work focuses on developing data e-infrastructures for science and scholarly communication across various disciplines. Additionally, he holds the position of Chief Technology Officer at the OpenAIRE infrastructure and has worn multiple hats as the scientific coordinator, architect, and researcher in various H2020 projects such as OpenAIRE-Nexus, OpenAIRE-Connect, OpenAIRE-Advance, and OpenAIRE2020. His current endeavors include shaping the European Open Science Cloud and holding pivotal architecture roles in EC projects like EOSC-Beyond and EOSC-Future, as well as contributing to the development of the European Commission Procurement for EOSC Managed Services “LOT1 - Core Federation Services for the EOSC EU Node”.

employment:employment-summary.common:department-name: Istituto di scienza e tecnologie dell'informazione Alessandro Faedo, Pisa, Italy
